step.context: \text{what is the condition for continuity of f(x)}\\ \text{at x=3?}

step.reason: \text{Just substitute the value of x in}\\ \lim_{x\to 3^-}f(x) ,\lim_{x\to 3^+}f(x) \text{ and }f(x)\\

step.tex:
\text{Using step 1, }\\
\begin{align} \lim_{x\to 3^-}f(x) &=\lim_{x\to 3^+}f(x) = f(3)\\ 3a + 1 &= 3b +3 = 3a +1\\ \end{align}\\ \text{So, for f(x) to be continuous the relation}\\ \text{between a and b is}\\ \begin{align} \Rightarrow 3a + 1 &= 3b + 3\\ \Rightarrow 3(a - b) &= 2\\ \Rightarrow a &= \dfrac{2}{3}.b\\ \end{align}
step.reason: \text{We have simply applied the condition for}\\ \text{continuity at x = 3. This gave us two values}\\ \text{in terms of a and b - which we equated to find}\\ \text{the relation between a and b.}\\
